comment.text: This translation key is used to display the label for a Microsoft sign-up button. It appears on the login form and is translated to support different languages, ensuring a consistent user experience across various regions.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Bulgarian translation 'Влезте чрез Microsoft' translates to 'Log in with Microsoft', not 'Sign up with Microsoft'. The English phrase implies creating a new account, whereas the Bulgarian phrase implies logging into an existing one.

While 'Rekisteröidy Microsoftilla' is understandable, a more natural and accurate translation of 'Sign up with Microsoft' would be 'Liity Microsoftin käyttäjäksi' or 'Luo tili Microsoftilla'. 'Rekisteröidy Microsoftilla' implies registering an already existing account, rather than creating a new one.

The translation 'Գրանցվեք Microsoft-ով' literally translates to 'Register with Microsoft'. While understandable, a more natural and accurate translation for 'Sign up with Microsoft' would be something along the lines of 'Ստեղծեք հաշիվ Microsoft-ի միջոցով' or 'Գրանցվել Microsoft-ով'. The use of 'ով' (ov) implies 'with' but doesn't fully capture the 'Sign up' action.

The Lao translation 'ເຂົ້າສູ່ລະບົບດ້ວຍ Microsoft' literally translates to 'Log in with Microsoft.' The English phrase 'Sign up with Microsoft' implies account creation, not just logging in. This is a significant difference in meaning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ອານຸສ້າງບັນຊີດ້ວຍ Microsoft (Anusang Banchi Duai Microsoft) - 'Create an account with Microsoft'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Inscreva-se na Microsoft' is not the most natural or idiomatic translation of 'Sign up with Microsoft'. While technically correct, it sounds a bit formal and clunky in Portuguese. A more natural translation would be something along the lines of 'Criar conta com Microsoft' or 'Registrar-se com Microsoft'.
The translation 'Cadastre-se com Linkedin' incorrectly translates 'Sign up with Microsoft'. It uses 'Linkedin' instead of 'Microsoft'.

The translation "Conectare prin Microsoft" is not the most natural or accurate translation of "Sign up with Microsoft." While "conectare" means 'to connect', "sign up" implies creating an account. A more accurate translation would be something like "Înregistrare cu Microsoft" or "Creează cont cu Microsoft".

The translation 'Vpiši se z Microsoft' while understandable, isn't the most natural or accurate translation of 'Sign up with Microsoft'. A more idiomatic translation would be 'Prijavi se z Microsoft'. 'Vpiši se' implies filling out a form, not registering or signing up.
The translation "Региструј се путем Microsoft-а" is a literal translation and doesn't flow naturally in Serbian. A more idiomatic translation would be preferred.

The translation uses a genitive case ('Microsoft-а' or 'Microsoft-ом'). While grammatically correct, consistency in casing and usage (with or without a hyphen) across the product would be important.  'Microsoft-ом' is slightly more informal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider enforcing a consistent case and hyphen usage across all Microsoft-related translations.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Registruj se putem Microsoft-a' is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'Sign up with Microsoft.' While understandable, it's a bit clunky.
The translation includes an unnecessary genitive case ending ('-a') after 'Microsoft'. This makes the phrase sound less idiomatic.

While "用 Microsoft 帐号注册" is understandable, a more accurate and natural translation of "Sign up with Microsoft" would be something like "使用 Microsoft 账户注册" or "使用微软账号注册". The current translation focuses on 'register' while the English phrase implies a broader 'sign-up' action.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 使用 Microsoft 账户注册
